AM.question: Define the term 'Code 12'
AM.answer: Duress - Refers to any duress situation.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

AM.question: Define the term 'Code 16'
AM.answer: Alarm Activation - Used to initiate an alarm activation.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

AM.question: Define an Active Duress
AM.answer: Active duress may be indicated by the use of electronic duress alarms to covertly advise another location/unit of a duress situation. Without alerting the person(s) causing the duress, that the alarm has been sounded. Other examples of active duress indicators include the passing of the wing duress word or failing to properly authenticate via the authentication code.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

AM.question: Define a Passive Duress
AM.answer: Passive Duress. Passive duress is three consecutive failures to respond to your radio call sign.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

AM.question: How is the duress activated utilizing a RA card reader?
AM.answer: When using card readers, adding one number to the Personal Identification Number (PIN) will automatically signal a duress situation to the BDOC.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

AM.question: What is the definition of a Partial Failure?
AM.answer: An intruder can cross only one sensor providing a detection capability without beingdetected, at areas where two or more sensors form a line of detection at the boundary or aportion of the facility or individual resource IDS (a line of detection for PL 1 resources) fails.
AM.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM FAILURES - CCAFS ESS Training Plan

AM.question: What is the definition of a Major Malfunction?
AM.answer: An intruder can penetrate a restricted area boundary without crossing a line of detection, afacility or individual resource IDS component failure that would allow an intruder to gainaccess to a resource without crossing a line of detection or detection capability, or either theprimary or alternate, if required, annunciator equipment fails (becomes inoperable).
AM.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM FAILURES - CCAFS ESS Training Plan

AM.question: What is the definition of a Catastrophic Failure?

AM.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM FAILURES - CCAFS ESS Training Plan
